sense.name: set one thing on top of anoter
sense.commentary: NOTE: This sense also includes arranging items into stacks. Includes STACK UP.
sense.examples: Both armies fixed the spears in the earth and stacked the shields. He crouched in front of her cupboard and stacked the supper plates inside. Abby had stacked the rolled-up futon and folded T-shirt on the chair. We stacked the bales of hay up to clean them. We stacked the shelves with the best dishes mom gave us.

sense.name: arrange the order of so as to increase one's winning chances;
sense.commentary: Include: STACK THE DECK, STACK THE ODDS.
sense.examples: How a lobbyist stacked the deck against internet gambling. The big resort-casino chains have stacked the odds in their favor. Dr. Woollard said smokers stacked the odds for premature death.

sense.name: meet the expectations of
sense.examples: How does python stack up to language X? Novels about the Cold War can't stack up to most non-fiction. Britain's energy policy just doesn't stack up to that of Finland.

sense.name: put aside for later use
sense.examples: Our vocabulary stacks away words in our brain for later use. The equipment and tapes he had stacked away are still there.
